title: Stressed about cgpa. How should I score more ?
content:
I got 6.55 in my first sem and 5.59 in my second sem. I am expecting to cross 7 spga this sem. 

By end of 6th sem i want to reach atleast 7.5 gpa. How do I do it? How difficult is it to score 8+ in every sem from now on . By seeing my gpa u should know that i am not so smart guy so give tips according to that.

Please leave some tips. üôèüèª

  
I have decent skills and I am sure I will improve by 6th sem. All I need is just elegibility to attend Tier 1 placements round 1. How much % of companies will I be able to sit in ?

comments.body: Which department do you belong to?
ur cooked broski , tier one will be next to impossible , iirc u need 8.5+ for tier one

Are scenes really this bad for low gpa ppl?

What about those who have 8+?

Time to pull up your socks OP. It's going to be really difficult with that GPA. Shut everything else, grind academics the next few semesters and pray to lady luck. A poor GPA cannot be compensated with DSA skills and a good profile.
Don't seek validation or hopes OP. Grind your ass off you can't do anything else
Bhai freshers ye sab kyu answer krrhe hein üò≠üò≠
That is true as far is I know tiers are given based on CTC offered and not cgpa cut off
brother sit and grind stop going pubs every Friday
Don't get below C in any subject and your gpa won't dip below 7.

Hey, don't think too much about the end result of placements, ace ur isa, and as cliche as it sounds take it one step at a time. Also don't think too much about tier 1,2,3. First focus on getting that gpa above 7. You'll be eligible for 75% of the companies. 
Don't waste time at the start of your next semester, because once isa1 gets over, there is no coming back or " I will shut up and study" because you'll have assignments and isa 2 in no time. So be proactive, study hard, make notes at home. If you get above 85% in ur isas it would give you enough momentum and you'll be technically good enough to do well in the ESA. Don't learn for the sake of marks and study to become a good engineer as all 4th sem subjects are important fundamentals.
